conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple wall faces (top/side) are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the viewpoint is elevated/isometric rather than top-down.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and thickness; clean cutaway with interior exposed. Minor imperfections from simplified/abrupt cut edges in a few areas.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen+utility, multiple toilets, balconies). Some proportional/layout interpretation differences vs the 2D (notably the long deck/balcony zone and a few partition extents), and some openings are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa, dining), kitchen modeled, bathrooms include fixtures. Some rooms/elements are simplified and not all pieces match the 2D furnishing intent exactly.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with distinct walls/floors and adequate lighting. Room text labels are present on the 3D floor surfaces (presentation/UI contamination), and materials are somewhat uniform.

detected_errors.description: Room name text labels are embedded/visible in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Some proportional/layout interpretation differences compared to the 2D plan (notably the long deck/balcony region and a few partition lengths/offsets).
Door/window/opening placements and sizes appear simplified; a few openings do not precisely match the 2D plan’s locations/proportions.
Furniture is generally correct but simplified; some pieces and orientations do not perfectly correspond to the 2D furnishing depiction.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with some proportional/partition interpretation differences and simplified openings plus visible text labels.
